com.google.gwt.gears.localserver.client
Class ResourceStore

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.gears.localserver.client.ResourceStore

public class ResourceStore
extends java.lang.Object

Manages an ad-hoc collection of captured URLs, which can be served locally.

Method Detail

abortCapture

public void abortCapture(int captureId)
Aborts the capture operation associated with the given captureId.

Parameters:
captureId - the ID of the capture operation to abort; must have been returned by a call to captureURL(String, URLCaptureCallback) or captureURLs(String[], URLCaptureCallback).

captureURL

public int captureURL(java.lang.String url,
                      URLCaptureCallback callback)
               throws GearsException
Initiates an asynchronous background task to capture the indicated URL. The return value is a captureId which can be passed to abortCapture to cancel the task. Relative URLs are interpreted according to the current page's location. Upon completion of the URL the appropriate method on the provided URLCaptureCallback is invoked. An additional HTTP header is added when Gears is capturing URLs: X-Gears-Google: 1

Parameters:
url - the URL to capture
callback - a callback to be invoked when the URL is captured
Returns:
an opaque ID to for the operation
Throws:
GearsException - if any of the URLs is not from the same origin as the current page

captureURLs

public int captureURLs(java.lang.String[] urls,
                       URLCaptureCallback callback)
                throws GearsException
Initiates an asynchronous background task to capture the indicated URLs. The return value is a captureId which can be passed to abortCapture to cancel the task. Relative URLs are interpreted according to the current page's location. Upon completion of each URL the appropriate method on the provided URLCaptureCallback is invoked. An additional HTTP header is added when Gears is capturing URLs: X-Gears-Google: 1

Parameters:
urls - a list of URLs to capture
callback - a callback to be invoked when the URL is captured
Returns:
an opaque ID to for the operation
Throws:
GearsException - if any of the URLs is not from the same origin as the current page

copyCapturedURL

public void copyCapturedURL(java.lang.String srcUrl,
                            java.lang.String destUrl)
                     throws GearsException
Copies the data for a given URL to a new name.

Parameters:
srcUrl - the URL whose data is to be replicated
destUrl - the new URL to contain the replicated data
Throws:
GearsException - if the source or destination URL is not from the same origin as the current page

getAllCapturedURLHeaders

public java.lang.String getAllCapturedURLHeaders(java.lang.String capturedURL)
                                          throws GearsException
Returns all HTTP headers associated with the captured url as a single string.

Parameters:
capturedURL - the URL whose headers are to be fetched
Returns:
the header string in the response that was captured and bound the URL
Throws:
GearsException - if the URL is not from the same origin as the current page

getCapturedURLHeaderValue

public java.lang.String getCapturedURLHeaderValue(java.lang.String capturedURL,
                                                  java.lang.String headerName)
                                           throws GearsException
Returns the value of an HTTP response header associated with a captured URL.

Parameters:
capturedURL - the URL whose header is to be retrieved
headerName - the name of the header to be retrieved
Returns:
the value of the header in the request that captured the URL
Throws:
GearsException - if the URL is not from the same origin as the current page

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
Retrieves the user-defined name of this store.

Returns:
the name of the store

getRequiredCookie

public java.lang.String getRequiredCookie()
Retrieves the name of the current cookie required by this store to be present in the browser.

Returns:
the current name of the required cookie, or null

isCapturedURL

public boolean isCapturedURL(java.lang.String url)
                      throws GearsException
Returns true if the url has been captured.

Parameters:
url - the URL to be tested
Returns:
true if the URL has been captured; false otherwise
Throws:
GearsException - if the URL is not from the same origin as the current page

isEnabled

public boolean isEnabled()
Checks whether the store is enabled for serving its URLs locally.

Returns:
true if the store is enabled, false otherwise

removeCapturedURL

public void removeCapturedURL(java.lang.String url)
                       throws GearsException
Removes the indicated URL from the store.

Parameters:
url - the URL to remove
Throws:
GearsException - if the URL is not from the same origin as the current page

renameCapturedURL

public void renameCapturedURL(java.lang.String srcURL,
                              java.lang.String destURL)
                       throws GearsException
Renames a URL that is cached in the resource store. The data captured for a given URL will be bound to a new URL, replacing the old one.

Parameters:
srcURL - the URL to be renamed
destURL - the new URL for which the data will be served
Throws:
GearsException - if the URL is not from the same origin as the current page

setEnabled

public void setEnabled(boolean enabled)
Enables or disables local serving for the URLs captured in this store.

Parameters:
enabled - the new state of the store
